html: An incident in the temple of his people’s city results in Jehovah’s house being set in order as Jehovah turns the tables on his people’s ecclesiastical leaders (cf. Jeremiah 23:1-2; Ezekiel 34:10; Zechariah 11:15-17). Together with other reprobates among his people, they are numbered among Jehovah’s “enemies” and incur his wrath: “They rebelled and grieved his holy Spirit, till he became their enemy and himself fought against them” (Isaiah 63:10; cf. 1:24; 42:13; 59:18). Jehovah’s voice—his servant whom he empowers (Isaiah 30:30-31; 50:10; 58:1)—pays them their “due” or “just reward” (gemul).
